intro: Hippocentaurea, commonly known as the rock centaury, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to the Mediterranean region and are characterized by their hairy, compact growth habit. They typically produce showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Hippocentaurea species often grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to dry, sunny environments. Their unique appearance and hardy nature make them popular among gardeners interested in drought-resistant landscaping.
